intro: Angelica ubadakensis var. valida, commonly known as the Ubadaken angelica, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. Due to its rarity and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
